body.p: Which one of the following best describes digitization of sound?

multiple_choice.choice: Many times per second convert the signal into a frequency with low voltage for low frequencies and high voltage for high frequencies.
Many times per second, convert the signal into a number representing the signal's height from the midline.
Many times per second, convert the signal into a number representing the frequency of the signal. Use high numbers for high frequency, low numbers for low frequency.
Many times per second, convert the signal into a number, recording the difference between this signal and the previous number.

response.feedback: Sampling (digitization) does not convert signals into frequencies using voltage.
Sampling (digitization) measures the signal moment to moment as a number.
Sampling (digitization) does measure the signal as a number, but not representing frequency.
Sampling (digitization) does measure the signal as a number, but does not record the difference between numbers.
